title: hStdOutput
extract: Stdout, also known as standard output, is the default file descriptor where a process can write output. In Unix-like operating systems, such as Linux, macOS X, and BSD, stdout is defined by the POSIX standard. Its default file descriptor number is 1.Oct 11, 2017
extract_html: Stdout, also known as standard output, is the default file descriptor where a process can write output. In Unix-like operating systems, such as Linux, macOS X, and BSD, stdout is defined by the POSIX standard. Its default file descriptor number is 1.Oct 11, 2017
